channel.title: Mopar Says My Server is Online
channel.description:
Hi, I have been developing a server for a while and I just tried to get it online. I have portforwarded sucessfully using portforward.com's tutorials. I changed my client's IP to [code]server = interpk.no-ip.biz[/code] and I have my no-ip DUC running with that host selected. Also my server and client are both running. HOWEVER I cannot seem to login, any help?
P.S. I tried regestering my server on mopar's status page and it was sucessful, until I had to regester a user and password.

item.title: Mopar Says My Server is Online
item.dc:creator: @c_o_l_d c o l d
item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

Thanks for the help, Ill edit my post once I find out others can join.

Read full topic
item.source: Mopar Says My Server is Online

item.title: Mopar Says My Server is Online
item.dc:creator: @reward reward
item.description:
@reward wrote:

client.java

change to

Others play using your no-ip
You play using 127.0.0.1 or localhost

(Dont forget to compile it afterwards)

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Says My Server is Online
item.dc:creator: @ppvagina ppvagina
item.description:
@ppvagina wrote:

this happened to me the no-ip is for the people who arent connected to your lan can connect you have to use 0.0.0.0

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Says My Server is Online
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“god of lust, post:2, topic:417270”]try using rspscoding.org enter all your information but before submitting anything in make sure you
refresh your no-ip DUC thing then restart your server you know open up cmd and submit your webclient
if that doesnt work you must have a problem with your ip cuz im pretty sure your suppose to put your
ip from whatsmyip.org not your no-ip cuz thats wrong.

which ever works for you[/quote]

You need to put the IP in a string. (ie. double quotes)

Read full topic
item.source: Mopar Says My Server is Online
